statements.name: PROC AUTHLIB
statements.help:
PROC AUTHLIB  <options>;
	
	CREATE 
		SECUREDLIBRARY='secured-library-name'
			<SECUREDFOLDER='secured-folder-path'>
			<LIBRARY=libref>
			PW=all-password-value </ new-all-password-value> | 
			
			ALTER=alter-password-value </ new-alter-password-value> 
				READ=read-password-value </ new-read-password-value> 
				WRITE=write-password-value </ new-write-password-value>
			<REQUIRE_ENCRYPTION=YES | NO>
			<ENCRYPT=YES | NO | AES | AES2>
			<ENCRYPTKEY=key-value</ new-key-value>>;
	MODIFY 
		<LIBRARY=libref>
			PW=all-password </ new-all-password>  | 
			
			ALTER=alter-password </ new-alter-password> 
				READ=read-password </ new-read-password> 
				WRITE=write-password </ new-write-password> 
			<TABLESONLY=YES | NO>
			<REQUIRE_ENCRYPTION=YES | NO>
			<ENCRYPT=YES | NO | AES | AES2>
			<ENCRYPTKEY=key-value</ new-key-value>>
			
			<PURGE=YES | NO>;
	
	PURGE CREDENTIALS | CREDS 
		<LIBRARY=libref>
			PW=all-password   | 
			
			ALTER=alter-password 
				READ=read-password  
				WRITE=write-password 
				BEFORE=datetime;
	REMOVE 
		<LIBRARY=libref>PW=all-password </ <new-all-password>> | 
			
			ALTER=alter-password </ <new-alter-password>>
				READ=read-password </ <new-read-password>>
				WRITE=write-password </ <new-write-password>>
			<TABLESONLY=YES | NO>
			<ENCRYPT=YES | NO | AES | AES2>
			<ENCRYPTKEY=key-value</ new-key-value>>;
			
	REPAIR  
		ADD | UPDATE | DELETE
			
			LOCATION | METADATA
				SECUREDLIBRARY=’secured-library-name’
				SECUREDFOLDER='secured-folder-path'
				<LIBRARY=libref>
				PW=all-password | 
				
				ALTER=alter-password 
					READ=read-password 
					WRITE=write-password
				<TABLESONLY=YES | NO>
				<ENCRYPT=YES | NO | AES | AES2>
				<ENCRYPTKEY=key-value>;
	REPORT 
		<LIBRARY=libref>
			<ENCRYPTKEY=key-value>;
	TABLES  SAS-dataset(s) | _ALL_ | _NONE_ 
		
		</>
			<PW=all-password > </ new-all-password> | 
			<ALTER=alter-password> </ new-alter-password> 
			<READ=read-password> </ new-read-password>
			<WRITE=write-password> </ new-write-password>;
			<MEMTYPE= DATA | VIEW>
			<ENCRYPT=YES | NO | AES | AES2>
			<ENCRYPTKEY=key-value < / new-key-value>>;

arguments.name: LIBRARY=
arguments.description: is the name of the physical library for which the secured library object is created and the security information is stored.

arguments.name: NOWARN
arguments.description: suppresses error processing.

arguments.name: PWREQ=
arguments.description: controls the pop up of a dialog box.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that a dialog box appear if a missing or invalid password is entered when required.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: prevents a dialog box from appearing. If a missing or invalid password is entered, then the data set is not opened, and an error message is written to the SAS log.

statements.name: CREATE
statements.description: Binds a physical library and data sets in the library to metadata by generating corresponding metadata objects in the SAS Metadata Repository and creating a record of the metadata objects in the physical directory and data sets.
statements.help:
CREATE 
	SECUREDLIBRARY='secured-library-name'
		<SECUREDFOLDER='secured-folder-path'>
		<LIBRARY=libref>
		PW=all-password-value </ new-all-password-value> | 
		ALTER=alter-password-value </ new-alter-password-value> 
			READ=read-password-value </ new-read-password-value> 
			WRITE=write-password-value </ new-write-password-value><REQUIRE_ENCRYPTION=YES | NO>
		<ENCRYPT=YES | NO | AES | AES2>
		<ENCRYPTKEY=key-value</ new-key-value>>;

arguments.name: SECUREDLIBRARY=
arguments.description: names the secured library object in the SAS Metadata Server.

arguments.name: PW=
arguments.description: sets a single password for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: ALTER=
arguments.description: sets one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: READ=
arguments.description: sets one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: WRITE=
arguments.description: sets one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: ENCRYPT=
arguments.description: specifies the encryption type.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies the SAS Proprietary algorithm.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies no encryption.

arguments.name: AES
arguments.description: specifies Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption and to record the key in metadata.

arguments.name: AES2
arguments.description: specifies Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption and to record the key in metadata.

arguments.name: ENCRYPTKEY=
arguments.description: specifies a key value for AES encryption.

arguments.name: LIBRARY=
arguments.description: name of the physical library for which the secured library object is created and the security information is stored.

arguments.name: REQUIRE_ENCRYPTION=
arguments.description: specifies whether all data sets in a metadata-bound library are automatically encrypted.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that all data sets in a metadata-bound library are automatically encrypted.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that data sets in a metadata-bound library are not automatically encrypted.

arguments.name: SECUREDFOLDER=
arguments.description: is the name of the metadata folder within the /System/Secured folder tree where the secured library object is created.Libraries

statements.name: MODIFY
statements.description: Modifies password and encryption key values for a metadata-bound library.
statements.help:
MODIFY 
	<LIBRARY=libref>
		PW=all-password </ new-all-password>  | 
		ALTER=alter-password </ new-alter-password> 
			READ=read-password </ new-read-password> 
			WRITE=write-password </ new-write-password><TABLESONLY=YES | NO>
		<REQUIRE_ENCRYPTION=YES | NO>
		<ENCRYPT=YES | NO | AES | AES2>
		<ENCRYPTKEY=key-value</ new-key-value>>
		
		<PURGE=YES | NO>;

arguments.name: PW=
arguments.description: modifies a single password for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: ALTER=
arguments.description: modifies one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: READ=
arguments.description: modifies one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: WRITE=
arguments.description: modifies one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: ENCRYPT=
arguments.description: specifies the encryption type.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies the SAS Proprietary algorithm.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies no encryption.

arguments.name: AES
arguments.description: specifies Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption and to record the key in metadata.

arguments.name: AES2
arguments.description: specifies Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption and to record the key in metadata.

arguments.name: ENCRYPTKEY=
arguments.description: specifies a key value for AES encryption.

arguments.name: LIBRARY=
arguments.description: name of the physical library that is metadata-bound.

arguments.name: PURGE=
arguments.description: automatically removes all retained metadata-bound library credentials if all tables in the library are successfully modified to the newer credentials.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: removes all retained metadata-bound library credentials if all tables in the library are successfully modified to the newer credentials.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: does not remove replaced metadata-bound library credentials even if all tables in the library were successfully modified.

arguments.name: REQUIRE_ENCRYPTION=
arguments.description: specifies whether all data sets in a metadata-bound library are automatically encrypted.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies that all data sets in a metadata-bound library are automatically encrypted.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that data sets in a metadata-bound library are not automatically encrypted.

arguments.name: TABLESONLY=
arguments.description: specifies whether the MODIFY statement action is applied at the library level or just to the tables.

statements.name: PURGE
statements.description: Removes any retained metadata-bound library credentials older than a given date of replacement.
statements.help:
PURGE CREDENTIALS | CREDS  <LIBRARY=libref>
	PW=all-password   | 
		ALTER=alter-password 
			READ=read-password  
			WRITE=write-password 
			BEFORE=datetime;

arguments.name: PW=
arguments.description: specifies a single password for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: ALTER=
arguments.description: specifies one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: READ=
arguments.description: specifies one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: WRITE=
arguments.description: specifies one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: BEFORE=
arguments.description: specifies a datetime constant before any replaced, but retained, credentials are removed.

arguments.name: LIBRARY=
arguments.description: name of the physical library for which the metadata-bound library is created and the security information is stored.

statements.name: REMOVE
statements.description: Removes the physical security information and metadata objects that protect a metadata-bound library so that it is no longer a metadata-bound library.
statements.help:
REMOVE  <LIBRARY=libref>
	PW=all-password </ <new-all-password>> | 
		ALTER=alter-password </ <new-alter-password>>
			READ=read-password </ <new-read-password>>
			WRITE=write-password </ <new-write-password>><TABLESONLY=YES | NO>
		<ENCRYPT=YES | NO | AES | AES2>
		<ENCRYPTKEY=key-value</ new-key-value>>;

arguments.name: PW=
arguments.description: specifies a single password for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: ALTER=
arguments.description: specifies one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: READ=
arguments.description: specifies one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: WRITE=
arguments.description: specifies one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: ENCRYPT=
arguments.description: specifies the encryption type.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies the SAS Proprietary algorithm.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies no encryption.

arguments.name: AES
arguments.description: specifies Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption and is required if specifying that data sets be encrypted with a new key value.

arguments.name: AES2
arguments.description: specifies Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption and is required if specifying that data sets be encrypted with a new key value.

arguments.name: ENCRYPTKEY=
arguments.description: specifies a key value for AES encryption.

arguments.name: LIBRARY=
arguments.description: name of the physical library that is metadata-bound.

arguments.name: TABLESONLY=
arguments.description: specifies whether the REMOVE statement action is applied at the library level or just to the tables.

statements.name: REPAIR
statements.description: Recovers security information (in physical data) or secured library and table objects (in metadata).
statements.help:
REPAIR  ADD | UPDATE | DELETE
	
	LOCATION | METADATA
		SECUREDLIBRARY=’secured-library-name’
		SECUREDFOLDER='secured-folder-path'
		<LIBRARY=libref>
		PW=all-password  | 
		ALTER=alter-password 
			READ=read-password 
			WRITE=write-password<TABLESONLY=YES | NO>
		<ENCRYPT=YES | NO | AES | AES2>
		<ENCRYPTKEY=key-value>;

arguments.name: ADD
arguments.description: one of these actions must be specified.

arguments.name: UPDATE
arguments.description: one of these actions must be specified.

arguments.name: DELETE
arguments.description: one of these actions must be specified.

arguments.name: LOCATION
arguments.description: clarifies whether the action is to apply to the physical security information in the file system, to the metadata objects in the SAS Metadata Server, or to both.

arguments.name: PW=
arguments.description: specifies a single password for a metadata-bound library.

arguments.name: ALTER=
arguments.description: assigns, changes, or removes an Alter password from the secured library object and from the data sets in the physical library.

arguments.name: READ=
arguments.description: assigns, changes, or removes a Read password from the secured library object and from the data sets in the physical library.

arguments.name: WRITE=
arguments.description: assigns, changes, or removes a Write password from the secured library object and from the data sets in the physical library.
is required if any options are included, such as passwords or MEMTYPE=. Here is an example:

arguments.name: ENCRYPT=
arguments.description: specifies the encryption type.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies the SAS Proprietary algorithm.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies no encryption.

arguments.name: AES
arguments.description: specifies Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption and is required if specifying that data sets be encrypted with a new key value.

arguments.name: AES2
arguments.description: specifies Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption and is required if specifying that data sets be encrypted with a new key value.
is required if any options are included, such as passwords or MEMTYPE.

arguments.name: ENCRYPTKEY=
arguments.description: specifies a key value for AES encryption.

arguments.name: LIBRARY=
arguments.description: name of the physical library where the security information is stored.

arguments.name: SECUREDFOLDER=
arguments.description: name of the metadata folder within a /System/Secured Libraries folder tree where the secured library is repaired or re-created.

arguments.name: SECUREDLIBRARY=
arguments.description: names the secured library object in the SAS Metadata Server.

arguments.name: TABLESONLY=
arguments.description: specifies whether the REPAIR statement action is applied at the library level or just to the tables.

statements.name: REPORT
statements.description: For a specified metadata-bound library, compares physical library contents with corresponding metadata objects (in order to identify any inconsistencies).

arguments.name: LIBRARY=
arguments.description: name of the physical library on which to report binding information.

arguments.name: ENCRYPTKEY=
arguments.description: specifies a key value for an AES encryption.

statements.name: TABLES
statements.description: Used after a CREATE, MODIFY, REMOVE, REPAIR, and REPORT statement to specify the tables to process a statement action. Also, you can specify the current passwords or encryption key value of the data sets in the TABLES statement, if different from the metadata-bound library passwords or recorded encryption key.
statements.help:
TABLES  SAS-datasets | _ALL_ | _NONE_ 
	</><PW=all-password </new-all-password>>  | 
		<ALTER=alter-password </new-alter-password>>  
			<READ=read-password </ new-read-password>> 
			<WRITE=write-password </ new-write-password>><MEMTYPE=DATA | VIEW>
		<ENCRYPT=YES | NO | AES | AES2>
		<ENCRYPTKEY=key-value< / new-key-value>>;

arguments.name: SAS-datasets
arguments.description: name of one or more SAS data sets.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: specifies password options to apply to all data sets.

arguments.name: _NONE_
arguments.description: limits the action of the previous CREATE, MODIFY, or REPAIR statements to the library level and does not apply the action to any table.

arguments.name: ENCRYPT=
arguments.description: specifies the encryption type.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: specifies the SAS Proprietary algorithm.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies no encryption.

arguments.name: AES
arguments.description: specifies Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption and is required if specifying that data sets be encrypted with a new key value.

arguments.name: AES2
arguments.description: specifies Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption and is required if changing and encrypting with a new key value and TABLESONLY=YES in the action statement.

arguments.name: ENCRYPTKEY=
arguments.description: specifies a key value for AES encryption.

arguments.name: MEMTYPE=
arguments.description: restricts processing to a single member type of DATA or VIEW.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: specifies SAS data file member type.

arguments.name: VIEW
arguments.description: specifies SAS view member type.

arguments.name: PW=
arguments.description: specifies the current password of the data set.

arguments.name: ALTER=
arguments.description: specifies the current ALTER= password of the data set.

arguments.name: READ=
arguments.description: specifies the current READ= password of the data set.

arguments.name: WRITE=
arguments.description: specifies the current WRITE= password of the data set.
